jobDescription:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.
We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.
You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills. All that in a work environment that offers a lot of flexibility because the well-being of our teams is an everyday priority.
So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.
Workplace
Our head office being located in Boucherville, on the South Shore of Montreal, we know that some of our employees are concerned by the roadwork being carried out in the Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine tunnel. That’s why we stood up an in-house advisory committee and implemented new work policies that provide our teams with even more flexibility, no matter where they live. Whether it’s working from home or having flexible hours – when a role requires employees to be physically present at the office –, we are constantly revaluating our practices to provide the best possible work environment to our employees.
Our expectations
The Analyst, Pricing Data is responsible for providing analyses, insights, and reports that help identify drivers of performance and guide appropriate tactical actions to improve financial outcomes.
We are seeking a dynamic and passionate person to support the Pricing organization. The incumbent will be responsible for accurate execution and coordination of the pricing strategy. They will partner with Merchandising and Finance to elaborate proper strategy for each category and collaborate in the strategic projects for these categories.
Your role
Implement base pricing strategy in partnership with cross-functional teamsIn collaboration with the Merchandising team, elaborate a pricing strategy aligned with the role and intent of the categoryMaintain the integrity of the product pricing classification (i.e. KVI)Provide advice and financial recommendations, and identify risks and opportunities concerning pricingAnalyze market price fluctuations and propose recommendations in order to keep a competitive pricing position in the marketAnalyze and maintain price zones, develop strategy and guidance about KVI (Key Value Items) and special programs, including Pro Pricing, Buying in Bulk, etc.Act as a business partner with the Merchandising teams while being a facilitator with the FP&A Finance support teamsDesign, develop, and distribute key reports/dashboards for the Pricing organizationIdentify opportunities for improvement, including new data sources, enhanced KPI, and better visualizationsWork with large, complex, and disparate data sources to draw meaningful inferences and insightsForecast margin/sales impact to the business due to various price changes
The Qualifications We Are Looking For
Bachelor's/Master's in Science, Business, Finance, Technology, Analytics, or related quantitative fieldsAt least 4 to 6 years of analytics experienceAt least 2 years of experience in pricing and retailHands-on experience and in-depth understanding of data analysis, machine learning techniques, Multivariate Time Series Forecasting (ARIMAX, SARIMAX), and Linear Regression ModelsExperience working with analytical tools like SAS/R/Python, SQL, Alteryx/KnimeExperience with business intelligence and visualization tools (MicroStrategy, Power BI)Advanced knowledge of Excel (Power Pivots, Power Query, VBA) and MS AccessDemonstrated ability to analyze financial informationStrong problem-solving skillsDemonstrated ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple competing prioritiesExceptional analytical and critical thinking skills, highly detail and action-oriented, and timely decision-making
Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada: 
By joining the Lowe’s Canada family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:
A highly flexible hybrid workplaceA fitness centre, sports activities, and showersA childcare centre that can accommodate up to 78 childrenA cafeteria with a delicious menu prepared by a dedicated chef, healthy options, as well as FARO Roasting Houses and Tim Hortons coffee stationsExclusive employee discounts, plus a 10% discount on store merchandise (at all Lowe’s Canada locations)Benefits: retirement savings plan, annual bonuses, stock purchase plan, student incentive program, etc.Electric car charging stationsCareer growth opportunities within the companyAn inclusive and safe working environmentPromotion of work-life balanceAn employer that’s involved in the communityAnd much more!
The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

Lowe’s Canada est une entreprise du secteur de la rénovation résidentielle qui exploite ou dessert quelque 450 magasins corporatifs et affiliés partout au Canada. Grâce à une offre de produits et services distinctive, des capacités omnicanal de premier rang et des formats complémentaires de magasins allant des quincailleries de quartier aux magasins de grande surface, nos enseignes Lowe’s, RONA, Réno-Dépôt et Dick’s Lumber sont outillées pour répondre à tous les besoins des rénovateurs amateurs et des professionnels de la construction.

jobDescription:
Req ID: 110850

Region: Americas

Country: Canada

State/Province: Ontario

City: Mississauga

16 Month Internship

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) is a US$5.8 billion global leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions. We bring global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges.

Celestica is a high-integrity work environment and when you join Celestica you are a part of a leading global company that enables the world’s best brands, and contributes to our innovative and collaborative solutions that help our customers unlock the potential of the future.

Our global network spans 13 countries with 24,500 employees across the Americas, Europe and Asia. At our Toronto headquarters, we are focused on attracting top talent into our organization, including interns from universities and colleges.

Celestica's internship program provides students with valuable development through real-life work experience, exciting projects and networking with industry professionals.

Benefits For Students Include
Experience working for one of the largest Canadian global technology companiesPossibility of a student casual contract position after completion of internship Possibility of a full-time position after completion of degree Access to Celestica’s development programs and projectsCelestica's Time Off to Volunteer program – two paid days off to volunteer per yearFun intern activities including celebration events and networkingInternal recognition programs and rewards for stellar performance
What’s in it for you?
Opportunity: Job experience at a large Canadian-based global companyInnovation: We look to our employees to implement new ideas and improve the way we do thingsCollaboration: Students work as part of global teams, enabled by collaborative technologySustainability: We uphold strong ethics, reduce our impact on the environment and empower employees to give back to the community with two paid days off per year to volunteerDevelopment opportunities: including soft skills courses, innovation projects and mentorshipNetworking: Strategically build your professional network to advance your career and deepen relationships across your peers and colleaguesFun: Our interns have the opportunity to participate in fun activities including intern social events, Celestica’s charitable initiatives and our Spirit Week activities 
About This Opportunity

The Inventory & Data Analytics Intern will work on analytics, dashboards and visual cadence on business governance. They will support analytics, automation and visibility of the business to support Inventory, Supplier Governance and SIOP (Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning) activities.

Preferred Skills
Strong knowledge in Microsoft (Advanced Excel skills) and Google SuitesAbility to analyze complex dataFinance background will be an assetA positive and energetic attitude with a drive to accomplish set tasksAbility to work independently and as a part of a teamAbility to be innovative and out of the box thinker
Activities
Perform data analysis on sales, inventory, operations performance and planning functionsSupport interpretation of data into information by working with a cross functional teamCreate presentations for sideways and leadership communication on business performancesDevelop and sustain KPIs to measure performance and success alongside a healthy governance cadenceAnalyze root cause in data anomalies and work with peers and leaders to correct dataSupport direct manager in overall strategic governance management, customer communications, visits and administration
Physical Demands, duties of this position are varied and will include:
Work performed in a normal office environmentMay require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed dataRepetitive manual movements are frequently required (eg. Data entry, using a computer mouse, etc…)Ability to lift up to 30lbs
Area: Operations/Supply Chain Management

Start Date: May 2023

Location: 3333 Unity Drive, Mississauga Ontario L5L 3S6

Experience: No formal experience is required

Education: Currently enrolled in a University Internship program completing 3rd year of an Finance, Business, Analytics, Supply Chain / Operations program.
As this position involves work that is subject to the Canadian Government's Controlled Goods Program (CGP), your employment offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a security assessment by Celestica and/or its authorized agents, per the Controlled Goods Regulations.
To apply, please visit www.celestica.com. Please provide a copy of your transcript with your application. Please include your student email address in your application.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates throughout the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Ensure comprehensive test coverage by creating well-structured test plans and test casesDesign and develop manual & automation scriptsResponsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, and regressing defects through the QE process utilizing a bug tracking tool effectivelyWork with testing data: seeding, masking, synthetic data generationWork with Big data platform to validate data ingestion, ETL, data integrity, data analytical reports etc.Analyze ongoing requirements to ensure quality delivery, aligned with business goals and enterprise and Technology Solutions (TS) standards.Work collaboratively with stakeholders across business and technology teams seeking opportunities to improve the quality of delivery and demonstrate commitment to operational excellence for all deliverables.Estimate testing effort working with other team members and set priorities following a risk-based testing approachCreate and run queries using Hue to meet business needsCreate and review test cases; Report test results and highlight any potential quality risksTo accelerate product delivery through test automation.Assess risk with projects delivery quality, identify and execute risk mitigation plans
What do you bring to the role?
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.5+ years experience in Quality engineeringProven experience within the Insurance Industry2+ years experience in the technical area of specialty, specifically SQL and Big Data Stack (Hue, Hive, Impala, HBase), BigQuery, Cloud, Python/Pyspark or similar data platformStrong ability to analyze the business and user requirements and translate them into testing deliverables such as testing data, SQL query and expected resultsStrong ability to develop test plans and run analysis on testing resultsExperience in data ingestion, ETL testing, data integrity testing and Data lake/Cloud testingExperience in any DH Automation tools or technologies (Python/Pyspark)Experience in Agile software development practice and methodologiesGoal-oriented; must be able to remove roadblocks and deliver goalsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsProven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical

Petline

jobDescription:
Company Profile
Oceaneering is a global provider of engineered services and products, primarily to the offshore energy industry. We develop products and services for use throughout the lifecycle of an offshore oilfield, from drilling to decommissioning. We operate the world's premier fleet of work class ROVs. Additionally, we are a leader in offshore oilfield maintenance services, umbilicals, subsea hardware, and tooling. We also use applied technology expertise to serve the defense, entertainment, material handling, aerospace, science, and renewable energy industries.
Position Summary
The S&P (Survey and Positioning) Survey Data Analyst is responsible for data processing and analysis activities required for job preparation, field support, office QC, final reporting QC, final deliverable QC, and project close out activities assigned by Project Management. This position operates company supplied computers with appropriate software programs to support data processing and analysis tasks while interfacing closely with the offshore staff, GIS and Project Management teams to support a range of survey efforts and deliverables.
Everyday activities may include, but are not limited to, data processing and analysis support for: surface navigation setup and calibration (DGPS, vessel offsets, Gyro, and MRU), spool and jumper metrology (acoustic and inertial), subsea navigation setup, calibration, and data acquisition (USBL, LBL, and INS), and report QC.
Involvement with and support of the Company's competency, HSE and quality programs is expected.
Essential
 Duties & Responsibilities 
 Provide data management, QC, and analysis to a wide range of survey disciplines  Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal  Attention to detail  Timely and diligent execution of assigned tasks  Ability to work independently and as a team member  Willingness to mentor other team members  Comply with company safety rules and training, conduct operations safely and report any unsafe condition or practices immediately to his / her supervisor  Assist, train and directly work within regional offices 
Required
 Qualifications 
 Bachelor’s degree or higher in related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience  A minimum of five (5) years of experience in offshore and / or onshore surveying, preferably in the offshore activities detailed above, or demonstrates the equivalent skill level and knowledge to perform required duties  Must demonstrate practical experience of data management, data analysis, mapping and data standards and associated software  Possess adequate M365 Microsoft skills, specifically Word, Outlook, Excel, Teams, and OneNote  Have beginning AutoCAD and other required software knowledge  Understand DGPS, geodetics, metrology, LBL, and surface / subsea survey sensors  A self-motivated individual who adapts quickly with today's virtual knowledge, self-disciplined with a work schedule remotely from home and/or another designated geographic area as needed in order to support the department needs 
DESIRED
 ROV data processing ability using NaviEdit and NaviModel, specifically multibeam oriented surveys  Photogrammetric knowledge, specifically using Agisoft Metashape  Dimensional Control experience  Strong technical writing abilities 
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, And Other Characteristics
Planning and Organizing / Human Resource Management / Developing Others/ Decision Making / Results Orientation:
 Ability to make objective decisions timely and effectively  Skill to recognize when decisions or information should be referred to a higher authority  Ability to establish and maintain project priorities  Skill to effectively manage time and organize information to meet operational needs and desired outcomes  Provides/ develops appropriate documentation to track progress of a project 
Health and Safety / Technology / Stress Management / Thoroughness / Analytical Thinking / Forward Thinking:
 Knowledge of methods and techniques used in safety inspections and accident prevention  Knowledge of principles, practices and methods of safety and health as it relates to employees and the public  Skill to work effectively under pressure  Ability to use various information technology systems required for successful job performance  Be able to prepare numerous work product types under supervision 
Client Focus / Communication / Ethics and Integrity / Business Administration / Accounting and Financial:
 Ability to determine and meet customer needs  Respond to clients in a positive and truthful manner  Ensures that regular and consistent communication takes place within area of responsibility  Maintain inter-office and project confidentiality  Respond politely to members of the community  Working as a team member/ getting along with co-workers  Responding in a positive manner to supervision  Ability to accept responsibility for your actions  High standards of honesty, integrity, trust, and ethical behavior 
 Equal Opportunity Employer 
All qualified candidates will receive consideration for all positions without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other non-merit factors.
companyDescription:
Oceaneering pushes the frontiers of deep water, space and motion entertainment environments to execute with new, leading-edge connections to solve tomorrow’s challenges, today.
 
As the trusted subsea connection specialist, our experience combined with the depth and breadth of our portfolio of technologies allows us to engineer solutions for the most complex subsea challenges. From routine to extreme, our integrated products, services, and innovative solutions safely de-risk operational systems, increase reliability, and enable a lower total cost of ownership.
 
We are connecting what’s needed with what’s next as the world’s largest ROV operator and the leading ROV provider to the oil and gas industry with over 300 systems operating worldwide. With our safety-focused and innovative approach, we responsively and decisively react to subsea challenges while providing solutions swiftly and efficiently.

companyName: Mitsubishi Motor Sales of Canada, Inc.
jobDescription:
MITSUBISHI MOTOR SALES OF CANADA, INC.
Mitsubishi Motor Sales of Canada, Inc. (MMSCAN) is the sole distributor of Mitsubishi brand vehicles, parts and accessories to authorized dealers across Canada. MMSCAN is a fully owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi Motors Corporation which has a storied motor sports heritage and has been selling its vehicles around the globe for more than 100 years.
At Mitsubishi Motors we have a passion for excellence. We are committed to combining automotive innovation and exceptional performance in both our cars and our workplace, while enhancing the communities in which we live.
Mitsubishi Motor Sales of Canada, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. We are committed to building an environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. Mitsubishi Motor Sales of Canada, Inc. will support applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment process.
PURPOSE
The Analyst, Data will generate valuable findings of the business, category, and consumer to help Mitsubishi make data-driven decisions to achieve business goals. This position will work directly with and support internal teams and external agencies by gathering, cleaning, organization, and analyzing multiple sources of data sets from sources including websites, paid media, organic digital channels, CRM, customer surveys, ad-hoc reports, etc. This position will interpret these datasets to recommend actions that answer questions and solve problems and innovate and create business insights that challenge assumptions with data to inspire positive change.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
Collecting and organizing dataGather data from owned digital channels (website, social media, CRM), digital paid media, sales tools, ad-hoc and desk surveysCreate different data sets that best support the understanding of digital consumer journeys such as heatmaps and attribution modelsProvide internal teams and external partners with recurring digital metric reports and analysisAssist the implementation of a data management platform (DMP) by creating media taxonomy and digital audience clusters.Monitoring and interpreting dataAssist the senior manager identifying patterns, correlations or trends, and work alongside the digital team on recommendations that will improve performance and efficiency of digital and CRM campaignsAnalyze a variety of digital journeys (coming from different sources, having different navigation paths, responding to different call to actions) and identify insights that would maximize upper and lower funnel goals (awareness, consideration, conversion)Execute and evaluate creative A/B tests based on their performanceAnalyze how different digital audience clusters perform in digital paid mediaManaging data tools and reporting dataCreate automated reports and dashboards via Google Analytics 4, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Datorama and others, for internal teams that generate added value and faster access to informationPut together findings, insights, and recommendations through visual and concise reports (charts, graphs, tables) TYPICAL EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE PROFILE3 years of experience in digital marketing and data analyticsWorking knowledge of analytics and data visualization tools (such as Google Analytics, Datorama, Tableau)Skilled at using a combination of data sources to construct a profound understanding of websites or app performanceInnovative and creative, with a logical and methodical approach to problem-solving with proven data instincts and a clear understanding of the common pitfalls of digital analyticsFamiliarity with digital marketing tactics including online media (display, paid search, SEO), CRM, mobile apps and hands-on experience working with related dataFamiliarity with tag management systems (such as Google Tag Manager), and CRM platforms (such as Salesforce)Ability to articulate complex findings into concise, persuasive arguments in both formal and informal conversations with senior-to-executive level clients WHAT WE OFFERCompetitive salaryFlexible and collaborative work environmentFlex work scheduleExcellent benefitsRRSP matchingCompany car lease programLearning and growth opportunities

jobTitle: Analyste associé principal de la gestion des données - contrat de 6 mois (hybride)/ Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst - 6 months contract (Hybrid)
jobDescription:
McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans tous les secteurs de soins de santé dans le mais d'améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 12 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Cependant, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients compétents sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'
Chez McKesson, vous participez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l'entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d'édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
Résumé
Relevant du gestionnaire principal, Gestion des données, l'analyste associé principal de la gestion des données assure la qualité, la cohérence, l'exhaustivité et l'actualité des données de référence en veillant à ce que la création et la maintenance des données suivent les processus établis. Sa responsabilité consiste à traiter toutes les demandes et activités liées aux données de référence dans toutes les unités commerciales. Dans ce rôle, on s'attend à ce qu'il effectue des analyses des processus d'affaires, identifie les écarts et les inefficacités et propose des solutions pour aider à rationaliser les procédures. Ce rôle nécessite des interactions avec des parties prenantes internes et externes de diverses unités commerciales.
Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques
Gestion des données
Agit en tant que point de contact principal pour toutes les demandes de création ou de modification des données de base.Créez et confirmez les données de base dans les systèmes MDM.Gère les informations critiques telles que les détails du contrat, les spécifications des articles, les prix, les substitutions, les abandons et les paramètres d'intégrité des données.Créer, analyser et agir sur divers rapports de validation pour assurer le contrôle des données de base.Travailler directement avec les parties concernées internes et externes pour obtenir et valider les informations pertinentes des données de base et communiquer les normes et processus requis, en assurant la qualité et l'intégrité des données.Communiquer aux commerciaux concernés toute information pertinente reçue des partenaires internes ou externes.Assurer la qualité des informations du système, le référentiel de décisions et l'exactitude de son contenu.Signaler aux fournisseurs toute l'efficacité liée aux informations sur les articles et les prix.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe de soutien informatique concernée pour parvenir à une résolution.
Section B - Responsabilités générales
Autres
Maintient une connaissance commerciale pertinente des processus de données de référence, des systèmes de MDM et des exigences commerciales.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe d'assistance informatique concernée pour parvenir à une solution.Participe aux initiatives et aux projets de gestion des données de référence.Agit en tant qu'ambassadeur McKesson des valeurs de l'entreprise.
Section C - Exigences du poste
Éducation
Baccalauréat en commerce ou en administration, gestion des données ou équivalence d'expérience en affaires.
Développement personnel et compétences générales
Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l'écrit et à l'oral.Leadership démontré.Excellentes compétences en matière de partenariat.Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite.Capacité à interagir avec divers niveaux de gestion et d'employés.
Compétences techniques
Expérience dans les domaines de la gestion des données, de l'analyse et de la création de requêtes, un atout important.Parfaitement bilingue, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral.Maîtrise des systèmes ERP et des systèmes de réapprovisionnement, un atout.Connaissance approfondie des produits MS Office (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project et Visio).Connaissance de SAP (un atout)
Autres compétences et aptitudes
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique en évolution rapide.Capacité à travailler au sein d'équipes multifonctionnelles.Souci du détail, tout en conservant un sens aigu de la synthèse et une capacité à synthétiser.Capacités d'analyse permettant la création d'un état d'esprit favorisant l'innovation.Esprit d'équipe.Capacité à travailler efficacement avec peu de supervision
Le.la titulaire de ce poste aura à soutenir de façon quotidienne des clients internes et/ou externes à l'extérieur du Québec et/ou aux États-Unis. Par conséquent, ce poste requiert une maîtrise de l'anglais à l'écrit et à l'oral. Veuillez noter que le nombre de postes dont les tâches nécessitent une connaissance de la langue anglaise a été restreint dans la mesure du possible.
_________________________________________________________________________________________________
McKesson is in the business of better health, and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Management, the Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst assures the quality, consistency, completeness and timeliness of the Master Data information by ensuring the creation and maintenance of the data follows established processes. Their responsibility is to process all Master Data requests and activities across all business units. Performing business process analyses, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions to help streamline the procedures is expected in this role. This role requires interactions with internal and external stakeholders from various business units.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Master Data Management
Acts as the main point of contact for all requests for creation or modification of Master Data.Creates and maintains Master Data in MDM systems.Manages critical information such as contract details, item specifications, pricing, substitutions, discontinuations and data integrity parameters.Creates, analyzes and acts upon various validation reports to ensure control of the Master Data.Works directly with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and validate relevant Master Data information and communicates the required standards and processes, assuring data quality and integrity.Communicates to applicable business partners any relevant information received from internal or external stakeholders.Ensures system information quality, decisions repository and its content accuracy.Reports supplier non-compliance on any inefficiencies related to item and pricing information.Solve technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.
Other
Section B – General Responsibilities
Maintains relevant business knowledge of Master Data processes, MDM systems and business requirements.Solves technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.Actively participates in master data management initiatives and projects.Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.
Section C – Position Requirements
Education
Bachelor of Commerce or Administration, Data Management or business experience equivalence.
Personal Development and Soft Skills
Bilingualism (English and French) in writing and speakingDemonstrated leadership.Excellent partnering skills.Excellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to collaborate with various levels of management and employees.
Technical Skills
Experience in the fields of data management, analysis and query creation a strong assetPerfectly bilingual, both written and spoken.Proficiency with ERP systems and replenishment systems an asset.Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).Knowledge of SAP (an asset)
Other Skills And Capabilities
Ability to work in a rapidly changing dynamic environmentAbility to work as part of multi-functional teams.Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.Analytical capacities allowing the creation of a state of mind favoring innovationTeam player.Ability to work effectively with little supervision
The incumbent of this position will provide daily support to internal and/or external clients outside Quebec and/or in the United States. Therefore, he/she must be proficient in spoken and written English. Please note that the number of positions requiring English language skills has been limited where possible.
Niveau de carrière – IC – Professionnel – P2
At McKesson, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please click here.
As part of Total Rewards, we are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered.
Our Base Pay Range for this position
$53,900 - $89,800

companyDescription:
At McKesson Canada, our vision is to improve care in every setting — one product, one partner, one patient at a time. 
We partner with hospitals, physicians, pharmacies, nurses, biopharmaceutical manufacturers and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier communities. By helping our partners be as successful as possible, we work together to improve patients’ lives.
-
Chez McKesson Canada, notre vision est d'améliorer les soins dans tous les contextes — un produit, un partenaire, un patient à la fois. 
Nous travaillons en partenariat avec des hôpitaux, des médecins, des pharmacies, des infirmières, des fabricants de produits biopharmaceutiques et d'autres dans l'ensemble du système de santé pour bâtir des communautés plus saines. En aidant nos partenaires à avoir le plus de succès possible, nous travaillons ensemble pour améliorer la vie des patients.

jobDescription:
POUQUOI SOLLIO AGRICULTURE?Vous ferez partie du plus grand réseau agricole canadien, créé par et pour les producteurs il y a plus de 100 ans. Vous aiderez ainsi les agriculteurs de chez nous à grandir, progresser et prospérer. Comme eux, nous sommes passionnés et tournés vers l’avenir. L’agriculture, c’est tout un défi. C’est pour ça que nous avançons ensemble, dans le bon sens.
A titre d’expert de données au sein de votre équipe et des divisions et unités d’affaires, vous participerez à la transformation de Sollio Agriculture en une organisation data-driven en participant à nos projets en intelligence artificielle et en intelligence d’affaires, notamment la modernisation de l’entrepôt de données vers l’infonuagique, la gouvernance de données, la mise en place de l’analytique et du libre-service aux utilisateurs avec Power BI.
Relevant du Directeur principal produits numériques analytique et innovation votre mandat consistera principalement à :Participer aux projets d’intelligence artificielle et d’intelligence d’affaires qui permettrons à Sollio Agriculture de devenir une organisation data-driven;Développer une excellente compréhension des processus d’affaires et agir à titre d’expert de données au sein de votre équipe et des différentes divisions et unités d’affaires de Sollio Agriculture;Définir les besoins d’affaires et opérationnels des clients internes et rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles nécessaires au développement (intégration et préparation de données);Coordonner la réalisation de solutions avec l’équipe de développement informatique;Concevoir et effectuer les tests fonctionnels afin de rendre les solutions efficaces et efficientes;Développer et produire différents outils, rapports, tableaux de bord et indicateurs de performance notamment pour nos plateformes numériques;Créer et maintenir la documentation technique, fonctionnelle et usagers des solutions;Exercer un rôle-conseil auprès des clients internes dans l’utilisation des données et des divers outils en intelligences d’affaires;Animer des ateliers de formation et une communauté d’utilisateurs;Collaborer avec les partenaires externes de Sollio Agriculture en intelligence d’affaires et intelligence artificielle et veiller à une prestation de service de qualité;Assurer la sécurité des données et la mise en place de la gouvernance;Assurer une vigie des meilleures pratiques dans le domaine de l'intelligence d'affaires, notamment au niveau des outils technologiques.
VOUS DÉTENEZ LE PROFIL SUIVANT :Vous possédez un Baccalauréat en administration des affaires, analytique ou intelligence d’affaires, informatique ou tout autre domaine relié au poste;Vous possédez de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience pertinente, notamment dans la manipulation et la transformation des données;Vous avez une excellente maîtrise d’Excel;Vous avez une bonne connaissance des outils de visualisation de données Power BI et Tableau Software;Vous avez des connaissances au niveau des langages et outils suivants : Langage SQL et R, ETL SSIS, Azure Data Factory et Google analytics (en atout)En atout, vous possédez de l’expérience pertinente en lien avec les modèles prédictifs;Vous démontrez un bon sens de l’analyse et de bonnes aptitudes pour comprendre les besoins d’affaires;Vous démontrez un intérêt marqué pour l’intelligence d’affaires et l’intelligence artificielle;Vous possédez d’excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite (français et anglais) et démontrez de la facilité à établir des relations interpersonnelles de qualité;Vous êtes reconnu pour votre créativité, votre souci du détail, votre sens client et votre facilité à travailler en équipe.
VOS AVANTAGES :Développer ses talents, ça veut dire prendre soin de soi, apprendre de nouvelles choses et partager ses expériences. On propose donc différentes initiatives pour que vous puissiez vous accomplir pleinement au travail, dont :Régime flexible d’assurances collectives et régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées dès l’entrée en fonction;Bonification annuelle;Rabais corporatifs auprès de nos partenaires (Olymel et BMR);Formations adaptées à vos besoins;Programme de reconnaissance entre collègues;Programme d’aide aux employés et à la famille et télémédecine;Plateformes virtuelles de mieux-être et de mise en forme;
companyDescription: Sollio Agriculture, the Agri-business Division of Sollio Cooperative Group, is a Canadian leader in the agriculture industry.It specializes in the merchandising of farm inputs and value-added agronomic services.It benefits from a synergy between three sectors: livestock production, crop production and grains.Present in almost every part of Canada, it has close to 1,100 employees and made $2.125 billion in sales in 2018 in Canada and abroad.For more information about Sollio Agriculture, visit sollio.ag.

jobDescription:

jobDescription:
Position: Data Analyst, Business IntelligenceLocation: Montreal, Canada
The Maples Group has operated in Montreal since 2009. The Group is a standard bearer in financial services, trusted by many of the world’s largest hedge fund managers, private asset firms and international corporations. In 2022, the Group was again recognized as one of Montreal's Top Employers by the publisher of Canada's Top 100 Employers list.
Our distinction flows from our carefully curated team: 2,000+ professionals characterised by tenacity, ethics and exacting excellence. We hire smart and sharpen smarter, arming talent with best-in-class resources and skills. Operating in key financial centres across the Americas, Asia, Europe and the Middle East, our international presence offers a unique springboard for career development and cross-cultural immersion. Our side-by-side financial and legal services are similarly ripe for interdisciplinary learning and growth.
The Maples Group looks to add a Montreal, Canada-based Data Analyst, Business Intelligence to our team and invites eager and qualified candidates to apply. Recognised as one of Montreal's top employers, we are committed to diversity, inclusion and equality of opportunity as we attract, retain and develop world-class talent.

About the RoleThe Data Analyst, Business Intelligence reports to Business Technology Manager and supports Business Technology Team.
Its tactical responsibilities feed one larger objective: To design, implement, rollout and support intelligence and reporting across our cutting-edge solutions. Delivering insights and metrics across our technologies for fund administration, middle office, fiduciary, treasury and regulatory business lines globally.
Providing a central point of expertise within the Business Technology analyst team to capture business requirements from our internal and external clients, to design, test and deliver market leading and impactful intelligence and reporting.
This role is a great opportunity for an experienced individual to make a significant impact in an agile environment by leveraging experience with relevant data management and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBi, SQL, SSRS, etc).

Primary responsibilities include:
Analyze and identify user needs, work on mandates to collect, process and analyze data, and ensure operationalization through cross-departmental coordinationBuild and develop complex reports using database management systems and make recommendations to support decision-makingIdentify opportunities to improve work methods and processes, and recommend improvements to data management toolsHelp clients define their needs, make recommendations and provide advice for selecting, implementing and using data management toolsDo research and perform descriptive and diagnostic analyses to ensure optimal data use and make recommendations in line with business issues and needs.Good understanding of the design process underlying the choice or design of a data visualization.
What You BringIn addition to indisputably high ethical standards and autonomy, the ideal candidate possesses the following:
Bachelor’s degree in a related fieldA minimum of three years of relevant experienceExperience in business intelligence or management information or data analysisKnowledge of visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, D3 library, etc.)Knowledge of MS SQL technologies (SQL, SSIS, SSRS) is an assetKnowledge of Denodo Data Platform is an assetKnowledge of Python language and relevant data science packages is an assetKnowledge of the financial services industry is an asset

Poste : Analyste de données, intelligence d'affairesEmplacement : Montréal, Canada
Le Groupe Maples est présent à Montréal depuis 2009. Le Groupe est un porte-étendard des services financiers auquel font confiance de nombreux gestionnaires de fonds de couverture, des sociétés de capital-investissement et des entreprises internationales parmi les plus importants au monde. En 2022, le Groupe a de nouveau été reconnu comme l’un des meilleurs employeurs de Montréal par l’éditeur de la liste des 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada.
Notre distinction est établie grâce à notre équipe soigneusement formée : plus de 2 000 professionnels qui font preuve de ténacité, d’éthique et d’excellence. Nous recrutons des personnes intelligentes et perfectionnons leurs talents en leur fournissant les meilleures ressources et en développant leurs compétences. Active dans les principaux centres financiers d’Amérique, d’Asie, d’Europe et du Moyen-Orient, notre présence internationale offre un tremplin unique pour le perfectionnement professionnel et l’immersion interculturelle. Nos services financiers et juridiques sont également favorables à l’apprentissage et à la croissance interdisciplinaires.
Le Groupe Maples souhaite intégrer un analyste en informatique décisionnelle d’entreprise à son équipe de Montréal et invite les candidats enthousiastes et qualifiés à poser leur candidature. Reconnus comme faisant partie des meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, nous nous engageons à favoriser la diversité, l’inclusion et l’égalité des chances en attirant, en maintenant en poste et en perfectionnant des talents de classe mondiale.

À propos du posteL’analyste en informatique décisionnelle d’entreprise relève du directeur de la Technologie de gestion et soutient l’équipe de la Technologie de gestion.
Ses responsabilités tactiques favorisent l’atteinte d’un objectif plus global : Concevoir, mettre en œuvre, déployer et soutenir la veille et le renseignement grâce à nos solutions de pointe. Fournir des informations et des données grâce à nos technologies pour l’administration des fonds, le suivi du marché, les fiduciaires, la trésorerie et les unités d’affaires réglementaires à l’échelle mondiale.
Jouer le rôle de pivot d’expertise au sein de l’équipe d’analystes en technologie de gestion pour saisir les exigences commerciales de nos clients internes et externes, dans le but de concevoir, de tester et de fournir des renseignements et des rapports pertinents de premier plan dans le marché.
Ce rôle est une excellente occasion pour une personne expérimentée de jouer un rôle crucial dans un environnement agile en tirant parti de son expérience avec Tableau, PowerBi, SQL, SSRS, etc.
Les principales responsabilités du candidat retenu seront les suivantes :
Analyser et établir les besoins des utilisateurs, mener des mandats de valorisation de données et assurer leur opérationnalisation en effectuant les arrimages transversaux requisConstruire et faire évoluer des rapports complexes en exploitant les systèmes de gestion de bases de données et émettre des recommandations en soutien à la prise de décision d'affairesIdentifier des opportunités d’optimisation des méthodes et processus de travail et recommander des évolutions aux outils de gestion des donnéesAccompagner les clients dans la définition de leurs besoins, faire des recommandations et fournir un soutien conseil dans le choix, l'application et l'implantation d'outils de gestion de donnéesEffectuer des recherches et mener des analyses descriptives et diagnostiques des données afin d'en assurer une exploitation optimale et de présenter des recommandations en lien avec les besoins et enjeux d'affaires.Bonne compréhension du processus de conception qui sous-tend le choix ou la conception d'une visualisation de données.
Votre contributionEn plus d’une autonomie et de normes en matière d’éthique incontestablement élevées, le candidat idéal possédera les caractéristiques suivantes :
Baccalauréat dans un domaine connexeUn minimum de trois ans d'expérience pertinenteExpérience en intelligence d'affaires ou en information de gestion ou en analyse de donnéesConnaissance des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, bibliothèque D3, etc.)La connaissance des technologies MS SQL (SQL, SSIS, SSRS) est un atoutLa connaissance de la plateforme Denodo est un atoutLa connaissance du langage Python et des librairies de science des données pertinents est un atoutLa connaissance du secteur des services financiers est un atout

jobTitle: Jr. CRM Data Analyst (6 months contract)
jobDescription:
The CRM Data Analyst is an active member of the Publicis Data & Insights Team. The CRM Data Analyst will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and providing insights that help monitor, optimize and deliver data driven recommendations to our clients on a regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and ad-hoc basis. This candidate must strive to ensure that the data used in the analytics process is accurate and robust. Candidates must also think strategically to identify issues that need to be optimized or resolved. The CRM Data Analyst will always work proactively to prioritize resources in order to deliver on the tasks.

As CRM Analyst, you will:

Contribute to analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysisCreate and/or maintain dashboards within Qliksense, Data StudioContribute and complete to regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests)Create complex data models using Qliksense to meet client ad hoc requestsDrive industry leading insights and recommendation on email, SMS, push campaignsAssist with efforts to optimize the client’s CRM business.

Qualifications

You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:

Think strategically in everything you doAre intrinsically-driven and celebrate every successEnjoy a variety of workAre a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skillsSet high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail rightDo what it takes to deliver on your commitmentsEnjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environmentWelcome and volunteer constructive feedbackAre able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processesThrive in a collaborative work environment that has an “open door” policy since we literally have no doors in our office.Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teamsBelieve in continuous learning and improvementDesired Skills & Experience

Experience in CRM analytics, ideally within an agency settingExperience in writing industry leading insights based on marketing campaign resultsExperience with SQL and structured datasetsExperience with Braze and/or SFMCExperience with structured datasets using SQL, or PythonKnowledge A/B or multivariate testing and analysis for CRM campaignsA big plus if you have had experience with Qliksense or similar data visualization tools.

Additional Information

Publicis Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of our community. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. If you require a specific accommodation please contact Human Resource
companyDescription:
Publicis Canada is a full-service agency, part of Publicis Groupe SA, one of the world’s leading communications groups with over 78,000 employees globally.

Publicis Worldwide NA:

Publicis Worldwide NA is a regional operation of the largest global network within Publicis Groupe. In North America, Publicis Worldwide has offices in Toronto, Montreal, Dallas, Seattle, San Francisco, Indianapolis, Boise, Calgary, Windsor and New York, their largest office in the region with 700+ employees. NA clients include P&G, Citi, T-Mobile, Cadillac, AFLAC, Chrysler (Canada), Wendy's, L'Oreal, Nestle, Home Depot (Canada), Abbott, UBS, West Jet and Pfizer, among others.

Mission:

We are a growth company. Using the alchemy of intelligence, creativity & technology we create brand attraction, desire and transaction.

The one constant in this world is change. You can either adapt to it, ignore it, or lead it. "Lead the Change"​ is both our mission and our call to action. It speaks to our entrepreneurial spirit and our roots as an agency. It defines the way we think about brands, ideas and relationships, and it's alive in our work. Change that helps them to redefine the landscape and forge ahead of the competition. Change that lets them become part of the public consciousness, and create a movement of passionate advocates. 

Publicis Worldwide:

Publicis Worldwide is a global creative agency, with 88 years experience providing change leadership for its clients. With over 12,000 employees in 84 countries, clients include Axa, BNP Paribas, Carrefour, Cartier, Citi, Coca-Cola, Haier, Hilton Honors, HP, l’Oréal, LG, Luxottica, Nestlé, Orange, P&G, Paypal, Pernod Ricard, RATP, Renault, Sanofi, Seb, Siemens, Telefonica, Total, and UBS. Publicis Worldwide is a part of Publicis Groupe.

jobDescription:
Position Description
We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and we're still growing! We have challenging career opportunities for several Data Engineers to work for our clients across various industries.
Data Analyst
Key Accountabilities: -
 Work with Product Owners and Analysts to understand business requirements and define technical solutions Knowledge of liquidity risk, asset and liability management risk, Benchmark reform rate would be big advantage Design and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models for the operational and analytical databases. Knowledge & Experience
 5-7 years of relevant experience Ability to translate business source-to-target mappings to relevant technical source-to-target mapping Demonstrates good understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle Strong SQL, Hive/Beeline skills Previous experience of working in an Agile Development environment Ability to work well in a challenging environment Strong troubleshooting skills Ability to multi-task and prioritize for self and team member
Attributes:
 Excellent writing skills, oral communication skills, strong process skills, and leadership ability Ability to prioritize time.
Your future duties and responsibilities
Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role
Insights you can act on
While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

jobDescription:
Position: Data AnnotatorLocation: Remote – Toronto, ONJob Type: 6-month contract to start with a potential for extensionHours: 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET, Monday to Friday
We are hiring a Data Annotator to join our client in retail on a contract basis.
Key Responsibilities: 
- Assist business clients in getting set up through an e-commerce platform- Classify and verify production information and directly affect the customer experience- Troubleshoot any issues that vendors may be having with the platform and escalate accordingly- Support with additional tasks and special projects- Assist with launching products and services on available retail platforms- Assist with data labeling and data annotation projects to improve catalog quality- Verify the quality of attributes (e.g. organic) through investigating various data points (e.g. image, external websites) to ensure we have high quality for these attributes- Review vendor results for data quality workflows to assess vendor accuracy- Review results for the brand workflow to standardize different variations of brands into the correct brand using internal/external research. This involves reviewing if the vendor’s answers are correct and conducting external/internal research to validate the correct answer- Maintain standards for high-quality catalog data and working with brands and content providers to source data
Key Requirements:  - Excellent written and verbal communication skills- Degree or diploma in Business Technology, Computer Science, or related field- 3+ years of experience working with large sets of data and SQL- Google Suite and MS Office is mandatory- Knowledgeable in data curation, data labeling, and data annotation- Must be detail-oriented and able to juggle multiple projects and tasks simultaneously- Excel experience and exposure to Excel commands is mandatory- Ability to learn new internal tools/in-house systems and processes quickly- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and team spirit- Ability to work independently, proactive/resourceful- Must pass a criminal background check
Please forward a polished resume to Arriane Liangcungco at arriane.liangcungco@quantum.ca.

jobDescription:
At SCI our people make us even better, which is why we want you to be a part of our fast-growing organization. SCI recognizes that having a great team is the key to success, which is why we attract and retain the right people with an employee experience that focuses on building trust, embracing change, and achieving our goals together. Any one of our 3000 industry experts will tell you that we take on some of Canada’s toughest service and logistic challenges in specialized transportation, technical services, and supply chain management. For 30 years, our proficient planning and flexible solutions have brought us top tier clients. With clear focus, operational excellence, and future growth at the core of our operation, we apply out-of-the-box thinking to deliver exceptional experiences that take our clients to the next level. Are you ready for your next challenge?
As BI Analyst, the incumbent will be responsible for implementation of new customer projects, change requests and managing day to day support of the business inquiries and BI environment. He/she will participate as part of a team in design and implementation of standardized reporting & analytics processes to support current and future reporting needs of business. 
What success looks like: 
· You work closely with stakeholders across the business to define, analyze, document and implement BI and visualization solutions.· You actively seek out opportunities to add business value through reporting and analytics· You are a key participant in the conceptual design of BI report development / dashboard & visualization solutions that meet business objectives in compliance with best practices· You support our internal stakeholders on requests for BI analytics with solution design from the bottom up, addressing: data modeling, analytical structure, security and BI visualization· You execute the design, development & support of reporting and dashboard solutions using PowerBI & Qlik Sense· Together with the BI Manager and IT / Data team, you collaborate on the design of BI/BW data models, data store objects, and information stores to sustain current and future needs· You assist in Design/Develop custom data sources based on business requirements in SAP or non-SAP systems or enhance standard SAP data sources· You prepare required reporting suite documentation including (but not limited to): functional specifications, design documents, testing documents (including use cases) and product release notes.· For reports/dashboards created by BI Team, provide support and maintenance of the Qlik Sense/ PowerBI environments including data loads, data integrity and accuracy.· You execute customer support including (but not limited to) training, investigation & troubleshooting of inquiries/tickets· You assist in developing, documenting and implementing enterprise reporting standards and best . 
What you bring to the role: 
· A Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Data Science or related field· 5+ years of experience design/implementation BI report development/dashboard & visualization solutions, incorporating best practices· Experience with data visualization tools including Qlik view/Qlick Sense, PowerBI and/or other visualization methodologies & best practices· Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills· Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment· You have solid BI analytics and dashboard development knowledge. Supply Chain or Retail Operations experience a plus. 
Who you are:   · You are results-oriented, with a strong focus on on-time, on-budget, on-scope and on-quality delivery.· You have the courage to think differently about how things get done to continuously improve and deliver even better results every day.· The safety, health, and well-being of yourself and your team, is your first priority.· Providing exceptional service is your passion.· You apply your strong analytical and critical thinking skills when problem solving.· When making decisions, you consider relevant stakeholders and engage those who can add value to the process.· You are nimble in your approach and prioritize with focus on what adds value to the stakeholders and customers.· Experience configuring and enhancing standard data sources.· Working knowledge of Scale WMS, SAP WMS, and TMS platforms preferred. 
 Working at SCI:First and foremost, at SCI, we are committed to creating a safe and healthy work environment, which is why we support our people with programs that serve the health and wellness of everyone. We also recognize that business moves quickly, and we strongly believe that success in our fast-paced environment is defined by the achievements of all our employees. We pride ourselves in the collaborative approach we apply to our work, and with a flat organizational structure, each employee at SCI is empowered to make a difference every day. Our people find success through their desire to discover new strengths, learn new skills, and gain unique experiences. With a balanced compensation portfolio, we encourage our people to lead with agility and strive for excellence.SCI is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We thank all candidates for applying, however, only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview.
companyDescription: As a 3PL partner that is trusted by clients in the retail, e-commerce, technology, and healthcare sectors, SCI provides end-to-end supply chain solutions that improve their clients’ business results and customer satisfaction. SCI operates the most extensive national distribution and transportation network in the country, consisting of 31 distribution centres, 41 field stocking locations, 8 specialized white glove shipping hubs, and 13 configuration centres coast to coast. SCI is recognized as a Top 50 North American Warehousing 3PL by Armstrong & Associates, Inc. Visit www.sci.ca for more information.

jobDescription:
Change the future with us.
We are looking for dedicated and talented people who tackle ever-changing challenges, customer needs, and questions from colleagues with clever concepts and creativity. We embrace change and work with curious minds re-inventing the future of work. Join us and let us focus together on what’s truly important: making lives better with new ideas and the latest technology around the world.
Why you’ll love working for Siemens!
Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.Competitive total rewards package.Profit sharing available.Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!Employee perks and discounts.Diversity and inclusivity focused.
Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2022, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.
What will you do?
Reporting to the Quality Manager, you will be tasked with collaborating with all factory departments (Finance, Planning, Production, Engineering, Logistics, etc.) in order to analyse, organize and present data :
Work closely with various stakeholders to analyse, organize, use and present dataCreate reports, dashboards and performance indicators in compliance with Best Practices and standardsDraft reports, management indicators and dashboardsAnalyse data to derive insights for critical decision-making.
This position requires working in person at our Drummondville, Quebec site.
What will you need to succeed?
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering OR collegial diploma in Computer ScienceProblem solving and data analysis skillsAdvanced level computer skills, Excel, VBA (required)Knowledge of SAP softwareKnowledge of SQL language, an assetDisplay self-reliance and resourcefulnessAnalytical skills and ability to be conciseExcellent knowledge of French (spoken and written);Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written). The successful candidate for this position must be bilingual. Excellent knowledge of French and English (written and spoken) is required for this role and its responsibilities, for the following reasons :The position requires regular interaction with Siemens colleagues outside of Quebec, across the country and abroad.The position requires the use of technology or software that is only available in English.
About Us.
We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.
For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Siemens Canada is a technology leader providing comprehensive solutions for Smart Infrastructure and Digital Industries. We make real what matters by setting the benchmark in the way we electrify, automate and digitalize the world around us. Ingenuity drives us and what we create together in yours.
Making a difference together we raised $$385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.
To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca
While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

companyDescription:
Siemens is a technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare. From more resource-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to cleaner and more comfortable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, the company creates technology with purpose adding real value for customers. By combining the real and the digital worlds, Siemens empowers its customers to transform their industries and markets, helping them to transform the everyday for billions of people. Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, a globally leading medical technology provider shaping the future of healthcare. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power. 
In fiscal 2021, which ended on September 30, 2021, the Siemens Group generated revenue of €62.3 billion and net income of €6.7 billion. As of September 30, 2021, the company had around 303,000 employees worldwide. Further information is available at www.siemens.com.

jobDescription:
Job Description

Our Public Sector Client is looking for a Data Analyst

What we offer:
Pay rate is $40 - $50 /hr. depending on experience. Work Location: Work fromHome, occasional at site office location, which is located Toronto, ON M5G 2C2. Hours of Work: Monday to Friday - 7.25 hours per day which equates to 36.25 hours per week.Candidates Needs to be fully vaccinated.Full Time, Contract effective February 21 for a period up to two years. 

What you do:
The Data Analyst will report to the Manager, Data Management, Psychometrics and Analysis in Data Management, Psychometrics and Analysis Unit. The Data Analyst will assist with planning and conducting of statistical collection and analysis activities in support of various educational programs and policy initiatives related to provincial large-scale assessments. The Data Analyst will help plan, coordinate, and provide data management support and technical advice with respect to processing and analysis of data, as well as the development of processes to ensure data quality (e.g., integrity, accuracy, and completeness). The Data Analyst will collect, analyze, summarize, and disseminate relevant data on topics for use by internal staff and stakeholders. 

Who you are:
A College Diploma or University Degree in Statistical and Data Analysis 3-5 years’ experience Statistical and Data Analysis background. The position requires knowledge of and skills in theory, principles and concepts of data structures, database design and information retrieval, data architecture, and programming languages (e.g., SQL, R), statistical analysis and research, quality assurance methodologies, techniques, and practices.Knowledge and experience is required in research and statistical analysis principles and techniques, including multivariate inferential statistics (i.e., hierarchical linear modelling, data reduction techniques), and analytics tools and technology, statistical modelling, and forecasting-specific software (e.g., SPSS, SAS, R) which involves writing programming code to produce reports to research and prepare own analysis.Extensive knowledge of data usage to interpret and analyze data for quality control purposes. Strong knowledge of large-scale assessments, SQL, MS Office, and Power BI are all assets.Excellent interpersonal skills are required to deal with internal and external colleagues. 

Apply now—we look forward to meeting you!
