jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Key Areas of Focus:
In this role, you’ll get to: 
Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.
Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.
Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.
Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers
Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.
Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.
Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.
What you’ll Need to Succeed: 
4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areasEntrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 
It’s Great if you have:  
Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Company Description

Momentum Financial Services Group, formerly Money Mart Financial Services is a leading provider of financial services in North America. For 40 years we've been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of consumers and business owners. Backed by a retail network of over 450 locations and robust digital and mobile platforms, we provide access to cash and related products to help our customers achieve their goals. We operate retail locations in local communities and cities across Canada under the Money Mart® brand and in Quebec as Insta Cheques® and in United States as Money Mart® and The Check Cashing Store®.

Our highly skilled workforce puts customers first in everything we do. We serve millions of people annually with diverse and innovative financial products and services. Through this ever-evolving suite of services, we empower customers to manage their finances and improve their lives. Wherever customers are on their financial journey, Momentum Financial Services Group provides solutions.

We believe in giving back to the communities where we live and work. With the generous support of our customers and staff, we proudly contribute over two hundred & fifty thousand dollars annually to charities and non-profit organizations, along with using our time and talent to serve in local communities throughout Canada and the United States. We are looking for aspiring, passionate people who are dedicated to understanding and providing our customers with the right financial solutions utilizing a growing menu of products and services. We embrace diversity and offer a fast-paced work environment.

Job Description

GENERAL FUNCTION 

The Collections Analytics team is looking for a business analyst to perform analysis and reporting related to the company’s overdue payment collections efforts and strategies. This person will perform analysis, develop reporting, and identify/recommend collection strategy enhancements.

Duties/Responsibilities
Analyze delinquency and loss trends through ad hoc analyses (using SQL and other relational database tools) and reporting (using reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau and/or Excel)Work with functional partners to deploy tests, collect data, analyze results, and make strategic recommendations related to the company’s collections efforts and programsEstablish and maintain effective collections performance tracking ensuring that strategies are performing as expected and provide recommendations of changes in a timely mannerPresent findings and recommendations to business partners and senior managementAnalyze collections-related factors such as concentrations, product mix, delinquency, loss trending, and process optimizationCreate segmentations to differentiate customer behavior and collectability, as well as optimize treatment, timing, and messageIdentify key risk drivers, analytically segment the customer portfolio along these factors, and assess concentrations, exposures, and exception levelsWork with central modeling teams to build new scorecards and validate existing scoring models as they pertain to use in collection strategiesWork with internal and external partners to develop and evolve digital methods for collections and debt recovery operations.

Qualifications

EDUCATION 

Required: A Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Decision Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or Economics.

Experience
Required: At least 5 years of experience using analytics tools/applications, including SQL. (Additionally, experience with R, Python, and/or Tableau is preferred, but not required.)Required: At least 2 years of experience solving business problems with data/analytics within an analytics-related functional area, such as marketing analytics or credit risk analyticsPreferred (but not required): Experience within collection analytics and/or credit/risk functions of a financial services company.

Skills
We’re looking for someone who is highly skilled at the following:Performing data analysis using a range of languages, such as SQL, SAS, R, and PythonGiving meaning, insight, and purpose to information driving key business decisionsExplaining complex information to both technical and non-technical audiencesApproaching ambiguous business problems with sound business judgment and creativityEffectively managing and prioritizing projects and tasks, from multiple stakeholder groups, across project lifecycle stages (ideation, planning, execution, and go-to-market).

Additional Information

Benefits
Medical / Dental/ Vision benefits available Company paid life insurancePaid holidaysPTO / 401K / Tuition ReimbursementAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We invest in our employees, and offer extensive training, and development programs to set you up for future success. If we sound like a fit and you’re ready to start an exciting career with an organization that encourages employee growth, apply today! We look for bright, energetic, motivated individuals who are interested in learning and developing their career.
companyDescription:
For over 40 years, Momentum Financial Services Group has been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of the consumers and business owners in our communities. We rely on our large retail network and robust digital and mobile platforms to provide our customers with diverse financial products such as loans, check cashing, money transfers, and prepaid cards. 

We are a financial services company that began with the belief of putting people first. From the moment we first opened our doors to the company we are today – we have always stood by our goal to set the highest standards for customer service, convenience, and quality financial products and services.

As the word momentum implies, we want to help our customers get where they need to be. It starts with a moment – an emergency happens, an opportunity arises – and ends, not with an installment loan, but with a way to get back to work or take that next step towards the future. We believe in our customers, and we're here to provide them with a little momentum to build their positive future.  

Since we opened our doors in 1979, our goal has been to empower customers to manage their finances and reach their financial goals. We understand that a loan isn't just a loan – it's momentum to achieve a positive future. 

We believe in giving back to the communities where we live and work. We proudly contribute over $250,000 annually to charities and non-profit organizations, along with using our time and talent to serve in our local communities throughout Canada and the United States. 

Momentum Financial Services Group is a team of more than 2,000 people serving customers throughout Canada and the United States. Our employees' personal and professional goals are important to us. As a result, we offer training programs, competitive benefits packages, personal incentives, and other exciting perks. Visit our corporate website, www.mfsg.com, to learn more about our company and products.

jobDescription:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Profile Description 

Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

The opportunity

We are looking for a Data analyst, Controls and Compliance, Reporting and Analysis to deliver on reporting and analysis, development and automation of dashboards through Power BI, and to build our SharePoint site.

The Data Analyst will deliver on reporting and analysis, development and automation of dashboards through Power BI, and will build our SharePoint site.

Responsibilities
Collecting, organizing, analyzing and interpreting data to extrapolate patterns that will provide direction that can be used to take back to the business using visualization toolsCurate data from various systems sourcesPreparing the data set for the analysis by querying the systems or using reporting resources availableEvaluate the data quality and completeness of the data availableDevelop user-friendly dashboards using Power BI to support the business in data-driven decision making and operationsProficient with the use of Microsoft SharePoint collaborative platformHelp foster an environment within the organization that promotes the use of data and analytics as a tool to support business decisionsOther Duties as assigned
What motivates you?
You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.
What We Are Looking For
You will have analytical skills, ability to derive value from dataYou will be a self-proclaimed data analyst using Power BI and Excel. It would be nice to have SQL and Python knowledgeYou will be confident working and maintaining SharePoint sitesIT Audit and Technology risk experience is preferred but not required
What can we offer you?
A competitive salary and benefits packages.A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.A focus on growing your career path with us.Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.Professional development and leadership opportunities.
Our commitment to you
Values-first culture We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.Boundless opportunity We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.Continuous innovation We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.Championing Corporate Citizenship We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.
Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock And Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Manulife is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We have more than 38,000 employees, over 115,000 agents serving ~33 million customers worldwide, and over $1.3 trillion in assets under management and administration.

jobDescription:
Ally and Your Career 
Motors Insurance Corporation (MIC) only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too? 

 The Opportunity 

Primary responsibility of this role is to support the MIC Field Sales Organization and channel strategies through field-related reporting, operational efficiencies, and data management. Core job functions include all development, maintenance, and enhancements of the production reporting environment used to evaluate insurance sales performance. Outputs include enterprise-wide dashboards and self-service reporting tools as well as the reporting infrastructure used for ad hoc reporting and analysis.

The ideal candidate must possess a high technical capability and strong leadership behaviors. He/she must be passionate about delivering accurate results, possess an inherit curiosity and willingness to quickly learn, adapt and explore new leading-edge technologies, must be an innovative, strategic and creative problem solver, and must have demonstrable experience with the automation of reports (i.e. dashboards with drill-in capability)j, query logic (i.e. SQL), and some familiarity with various coding syntaxes (i.e. DAX, Proc SQL, Query-M)

 The Work Itself 
 Service the sales organization to support corporate objectives  Works closely with business leaders and team members and provides insight for the development and integration of new technologies, tools, and processes  Develop and maintain reporting infrastructure used by field operations to gauge performance and internal teams to perform analysis  Maintains monthly, quarterly, and yearly routine reporting deliverables  Communicates with matrix partners and stakeholders to communicate findings and raise high risk issues to management  Assists with special projects and completes field-related ad hoc reporting requests  Provides technical and analytical support to the team members  Executes on management oversight with enterprise projects  Ensures data validity, accuracy of results while adhering to compliance policies and procedures 

The Skills You Bring
 Bachelor's degree in business related field, concentration in Information Technology preferred  2+ years of system and/or report development experience preferred  Experience with relational database concepts and query syntaxes like P-SQL or T-SQL (Oracle or SSMS)  Experience with business intelligence reporting tools like SAS, Power BI highly preferred  Experience with MS Power Query and Visual Basic highly preferred  Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite – including Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, etc. and standard Enterprise systems  Ability to provide advice/direction in primary areas of expertise  Strong communication and interpersonal skills  Proven track record performing root cause analysis and troubleshooting techniques to quickly identify and resolve bugs and/or data-related issues  Validated experience with team collaboration on projects and meeting rigid timelines  Strong presentation skills, including ability to articulate complex problems in a simple manner  Experience with CRM tools like Salesforce.com preferred  Knowledge of dealer insurance products preferred  Ability to figure out solutions to problems with little supervision 

How We'll Have Your Back
MIC’s compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But MIC’s total compensation – or total rewards – extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including:

Who We Are

MIC is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers.

MIC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. MIC will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. 

Pay Range: An individual's position in the range is determined by the scope and responsibilities of the role, work experience, education, certification(s), training, and additional qualifications. We review internal pay, the competitive market, and business environment prior to extending an offer.

Emerging

70,000

Experienced

82,500

Expert

100,000

Incentive Compensation: This position is eligible to participate in our annual incentive plan.

jobDescription:
Are you looking to break into the field of data analytics and want to work in a startup environment? This is your chance to accelerate your personal growth by taking advantage of a highly meritocratic workplace, in a team where opportunities are endless.
As the team’s Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to create your own path towards your dream role in data. You will start your journey by becoming the expert in data analysis and actionable insights.
What’s the reason why each vertical across the company is having such performance in terms of operational metrics? What can we potentially do to maximize the results and efficiency of those same verticals? That’s for you to determine.
The team also handles advanced analytics in the company.. So if you’re bursting with creativity and want to get your hands dirty in turning your data into ideas for senior leaders, you’ll have green light and all the support you need.
Who are we?
Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.
Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.
We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!
We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage, and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions.
https://www.humi.ca/about
What will you be doing as a Data Analyst?
The data team at Humi manages company-wide data analytics and internal tooling for business processes. We focus on building efficiency through process structure and automation as well as helping leaders across the organization make informed decisions using the best data available.
As a Data Analyst, your responsibilities would consist of:
You will advise and coach leaders what happened (descriptive analytics), propose scenarios of solutions and potential outcomes (predictive analytics), and recommend the best way to move forward (prescriptive analytics)You will generate actionable insights based on company-wide data and department-level analytics, including trendsYou will be responsible for producing and analyzing corporate reports - such as leads to conversion rates, sales realization, client feedback, retention and churnYou will prioritize data requests and services, resolve them, or forward to other functions if needed and identify opportunities for optimization or automationIf interested, you will be given the chance to participate in advanced analytics projects, involving machine learning and data science

In your first 30 days, you will:
Onboard and acclimate with the Operations and Finance teamMeet with leadership and various key stakeholders in Sales, Client Experience, Marketing, Product, Engineering, Payroll and Benefit teamsLearn the fundamentals of the HR, benefits, and payroll industryBegin training on platforms and reporting tools: Stripe, Airtable, Zapier, Pendo, Xero, Hubspot, Zendesk, Google Analytics, Tableau

In your first 60 days, you will:
Complete training on platforms and reporting toolsManage your first sizable project from start to finishHave developed strong working relationships with various senior leaders and a good understanding of their goals and needsHave gained strong knowledge of Humi operations

In your first 90 days, you will:
Own our CRM: you will be the go-to expert and own the roadmap for optimizations and new internal feature rolloutsAdvise stakeholders and department leaders on best practices relating to all things data and platformsHave a strong understanding of the current state of assets across the department and mid to long-term goals for their expansion/improvementHave explored more technical aspects of the data operations team and started working towards a personal development plan to grow horizontally

In your first year, you will:
Be the in-house expert for a variety of internal tools & platforms (some of which you may have built out yourself)Have accomplished 2-3 significant career development goals (the growth opportunities in this role are endless, it’s up to you to decide where you want to take it!)

What are we looking for in a Data Analyst?
Post-secondary degree in a Business or STEM field1-2 years experience working in an analytical or strategic roleExperience working with SQL (Redshift or any relational query language)Experience working with Python (or any programming language) and Github (or any code repository tool)Experience working with Tableau (or any business intelligence visualization tool)Proven expertise in visualizing actionable insights based on business questions. Paint a story why the sales result is such, what are some of the potential ways to improve recurring revenue, and how to further increase retention and reduce churnComfortable working in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. Can you talk to examples of being given high-level goals and getting down and dirty to make them happen?Extremely coachable. Think of a time where you were thrown completely out of your comfort zone and successfully seeked out and actioned constructive feedbackYou can deliver complex information in a confident and convincing manner that is appropriate to different stakeholders. Ever had to convince someone that there is a better approach to something they really want to do?

Nice to Have Skills:
Experience working with or administrating a CRM platform (like Hubspot and Airtable)Experience with Pendo and Zendesk (client feedback and support systems)Experience or education in the use of data analytics, preferably including machine learningExperience working in a startup + collaborating with senior leadership in an entrepreneurial environment

Why join Humi?
As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employeesBe part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scalesMaintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiativeOpportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to

Please note that all successful candidates will only receive offers through the Humi platform and we do not issue offers outside of our platform. We do not make any offers of employment via social media. Please see our resource library for the best ways to detect fraud and fraudulent activity.
companyDescription:
Humi is Canada’s leading HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform.

Serving thousands of Canadian companies, Humi is the all-in-one people platform that your company will love. To find out why companies are switching to Humi, visit humi.ca.

jobDescription:
Position: Data Analyst
Department: Business Intelligence
Reports To: Manager, Business Intelligence
Position Summary
The Data Analyst is responsible for turning large amounts of raw data into insights and actionable recommendations. This involves working with stakeholders to understand their data needs, using a variety of software tools to extract, transform, and load data, and applying statistical techniques to analyze and interpret the data. This role also has a large focus on optimizing pricing strategy for all entities at Canucks Sports & Entertainment.
This Role Will Focus On
Identifying trends and patterns in data, and using this information to inform business decisionsDeveloping dashboards and reports to communicate data insights to stakeholdersCollaborating with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for data-driven improvementsManaging and maintaining databases and data pipelinesProviding data-driven recommendations to stakeholdersDeveloping pricing strategies and reporting for all ticket productsLocating and defining new process improvement opportunities
We Have
A team you can belong to and believe inA fun, high energy environmentAn open mind for new ideasThe opportunity to embark on a career development journey
You Must Have
Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Statistics or a related field1-2 years of data analytics experienceHighly proficient in SQL, Excel, and at least one BI tool (Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio)Experience with Python and/or RKnowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasetsExcellent planning, organizational, and problem-solving skillsAbility to multi-task and set priorities in a dynamic, fast paced, ever-changing environment
You Might Also Have
Experience with CRM (HubSpot, Salesforce or Dynamics) and Data Warehousing softwareKnowledge of Ticketmaster products, specifically Archtics and Host
Vancouver is one of the most diverse cities in the world and Canucks Sports & Entertainment strives to create a workforce that is inclusive, equitable, and represents our beautiful, unique community. We value unique perspectives, ideas, and creativity that support a diverse, inclusive, respectful, collaborative, and fun work environment. Canucks Sports & Entertainment is committed to building and supporting a diverse team.
This position will remain open until filled.

jobDescription:
We are looking to hire multiple detail-oriented, technically-minded people to join the Data Analysis team at DarkVision. The successful candidates will work collaboratively with their teammates to analyze our high-resolution ultrasound scans of oil and gas wells. They will use the results to create actionable reports, 3D images, detailed models, and quantifiable data to help our clients make informed decisions on the safe and efficient operations of their multi-million dollar operating assets.

No experience in this type of role is necessary, as the focus is on attitude, aptitude, and raw ability versus specific experience in a similar position. We're looking for someone intelligent, keen, and highly detail-oriented regarding data deliverables to help meet the growing demand for DarkVision's products and services.

As our scope increases, we require some Analysts who are apt to work odd hours. Willingness to work odd hours is considered an asset though not required.

Responsibilities:
Inspect ultrasound data using our proprietary software to locate features and defectsFollow detailed processes for preparing datasets and completing analysisMeasure and assess features in the data, utilizing Machine Learning / AI generated resultsGenerate detailed spreadsheets and plots using MATLABGenerate and edit reportsGenerate images, videos, and 3D rendersReview and aggregate information from client documentsAssist in improving workflows and documentationLearn and master new types of analysis as DarkVision increases its product offerings

Work Arrangement / Hours:
Willing and able to work out of DarkVision's North Vancouver head office; this is a fully on-site positionAvailable for occasional odd hours; customer jobs can arise at any time, and they often need answers as quickly as possibleThis position may include occasional working evenings or weekends outside of typical office hours

Expectations:
Diploma or degree from a STEM fieldExtreme attention-to-detail; you need to be meticulous, methodical, exact, and thorough in your analysis, making little to no mistakesExcellent communication skills, verbal and writtenWork well collaboratively; most projects will be shared among a group of AnalystsFast learner; able to adapt to evolving processes and guidelinesAble to follow detailed procedures and meet high standards for quality and consistency

Bonus Qualifications:
MATLAB experienceBlender or Meshlab experienceImage processing experienceExperience with 3D data

What's in it for you?
Competitive salary or higher (Top $ for top talent)Full benefits package.Competitive vacation allotmentFlexible work environment

About DarkVision

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a BC-based tech company that has been disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform and are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.

Backed by Koch Industries, the largest privately held company in North America, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.

We provide employees the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications and invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.

Why DarkVision

Here are 4 reasons you’ll like working at DarkVision:
Well-Funded: We are backed by Koch Industries - North America’s largest privately held company and are actively working with top-tier operators across North America.‘A’ Players: Our team is made up of talented, intelligent, and hardworking people. If you’re an ‘A’ player, you’ll enjoy the intellectually stimulating, challenging and respectfully competitive atmosphere.Growing Quickly: We are in the process of launching several new product lines and as a result, have more than doubled our headcount over the last year.Lots of Opportunities: We are transitioning into a much larger organization and recently expanded into a 52,000 sq ft facility in North Vancouver. We have recently opened a larger Calgary office and have expanded into the US with offices in Houston and Midland, TX.
companyDescription:
DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a BC-based tech company that has been disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform and are packaging it into multiple new product lines. Our rapidly growing team of experts from machine vision, medical imaging, aerospace design, and computer graphics have come together to revolutionize how industry quantifies and visualizes the integrity of critical assets.

DarkVision’s first product line for tubular infrastructure inspection has been highly disruptive to the market; it has won multiple industry awards, been featured in top industry publications, and generated significant revenue. We are now scaling the technology to numerous industrial verticals and building a platform to become the dominant player in the asset integrity game.

DarkVision’s proprietary technology captures the world’s largest ultrasound datasets by orders of magnitude. To do this, we design, build, and sell the entire solution ourselves. Our teams specialize in large sensor arrays, high-speed electronics, advanced ultrasound imaging techniques, 3D visualizations, and ML-based analytics software. DarkVision’s staff of Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers, Software Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, and Research Scientists develop cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications.  

Backed by Koch Industries, North America’s largest privately held company, DarkVision has begun scaling its Engineering, Sales, and Operations teams to meet the demand for both its current and upcoming products. Our head office is newly renovated 52,000+ sq ft facility in Vancouver and we have offices in Calgary, Alberta, Houston and Midland, Texas. 

We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.

jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.
Main Responsibilities
 Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30% 
Participates in data objects identification and businessrules profiling
Performs dataqualityassessment and qualitymetrics reporting
Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.
CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
 For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience. 
CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Ensure comprehensive test coverage by creating well-structured test plans and test casesDesign and develop manual & automation scriptsResponsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, and regressing defects through the QE process utilizing a bug tracking tool effectivelyWork with testing data: seeding, masking, synthetic data generationWork with Big data platform to validate data ingestion, ETL, data integrity, data analytical reports etc.Analyze ongoing requirements to ensure quality delivery, aligned with business goals and enterprise and Technology Solutions (TS) standards.Work collaboratively with stakeholders across business and technology teams seeking opportunities to improve the quality of delivery and demonstrate commitment to operational excellence for all deliverables.Estimate testing effort working with other team members and set priorities following a risk-based testing approachCreate and run queries using Hue to meet business needsCreate and review test cases; Report test results and highlight any potential quality risksTo accelerate product delivery through test automation.Assess risk with projects delivery quality, identify and execute risk mitigation plans
What do you bring to the role?
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.5+ years experience in Quality engineeringProven experience within the Insurance Industry2+ years experience in the technical area of specialty, specifically SQL and Big Data Stack (Hue, Hive, Impala, HBase), BigQuery, Cloud, Python/Pyspark or similar data platformStrong ability to analyze the business and user requirements and translate them into testing deliverables such as testing data, SQL query and expected resultsStrong ability to develop test plans and run analysis on testing resultsExperience in data ingestion, ETL testing, data integrity testing and Data lake/Cloud testingExperience in any DH Automation tools or technologies (Python/Pyspark)Experience in Agile software development practice and methodologiesGoal-oriented; must be able to remove roadblocks and deliver goalsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsProven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical
Sonnet Assurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline

jobTitle: Student Intern, Product Data Analytics - Global Quality & Reliability
jobDescription:
Req ID: 114540

Remote Position: Hybrid

Region: Americas

Country: Canada

State/Province: Ontario

City: Toronto

16 Month Internship

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) is a US$5.8 billion global leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions. We bring global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges.

Celestica is a high-integrity work environment and when you join Celestica you are a part of a leading global company that enables the world’s best brands, and contributes to our innovative and collaborative solutions that help our customers unlock the potential of the future.

Our global network spans 14 countries with 24,500 employees across the Americas, Europe and Asia. At our Toronto headquarters, we are focused on attracting top talent into our organization, including interns from universities and colleges.

Celestica's internship program provides students with valuable development through real-life work experience, exciting projects and networking with industry professionals.

Benefits For Students Include
Experience working for one of the largest Canadian global technology companies Possibility of a student casual contract position after completion of internship Possibility of a full-time position after completion of degree Access to Celestica’s development programs and projects Celestica's Time Off to Volunteer program – two paid days off to volunteer per year Fun intern activities including celebration events and networking Internal recognition programs and rewards for stellar performance 
What’s in it for you?
Opportunity: Job experience at a large Canadian-based global company Innovation: We look to our employees to implement new ideas and improve the way we do things Collaboration: Students work as part of global teams, enabled by collaborative technology Sustainability: We uphold strong ethics, reduce our impact on the environment and empower employees to give back to the community with two paid days off per year to volunteer Development opportunities: Including soft skills courses, innovation projects and mentorship Networking: Strategically build your professional network to advance your career and deepen relationships across your peers and colleagues. Fun: Our interns have the opportunity to participate in fun activities including intern social events, Celestica’s charitable initiatives and our Spirit Week activities 
About This Opportunity

The Product Data Analytics - Global Quality & Reliability Intern position is ideal for a person interested in developing operation systems in a worldwide manufacturing organization. The candidate will have the opportunity to learn and contribute to several key enabling functions in Global Quality organization. We are looking for a team player who possesses exceptional communication skills (written and verbal), is able to learn quickly, and is self-motivated.

Preferred Skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Understanding of Google Applications Critical thinking on how to leverage existing resources and technology to bring value to the business Strong analytical skills to present data in an innovative way to business leaders Time management and ability to prioritize and re-assess schedules and tasks quickly and effectively 
Activities
Collect and organize product quality and reliability data from manufacturing and engineering teams. Analyze data to identify trends via statistical analysis Create operation reports for CLS operations and engineering teams. Collaborate with Global Quality operations worldwide to achieve all objectives Participate in Global Quality programs deployment and support Participate in teleconferences, meetings with global counterparts. Participate in volunteering activities within Celestica volunteer programs Create and update website content. Quality communications for the sites 
Physical Demands, duties of this position are varied and will include:
Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data Repetitive manual movements are frequently required (e.g. data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) 
Area: Global Quality

Start Date: May 2023

Location: 5140 Yonge Street, Toronto, ON

Experience: No formal experience required

Education: Currently enrolled in a University internship program and have completed their 3rd year of studies. The ideal candidate should be currently enrolled in an Engineering or Business Administration major.
As this position involves work that is subject to the Canadian Government's Controlled Goods Program (CGP), your employment offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a security assessment by Celestica and/or its authorized agents, per the Controlled Goods Regulations.
To apply, please visit www.celestica.com. Please provide a copy of your transcript with your application. Please include your student email address in your application. 

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).

At Celestica, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates throughout the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
companyDescription: Celestica enables the world's best brands. Through our unrivalled customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in aerospace and defense, communications, enterprise, healthtech, industrial, capital equipment, and smart energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. A leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development - from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. With talented teams across North America, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers..

companyName: Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Ontario (FSRA)
jobDescription:
FSRA is guided by our vision of financial safety, fairness and choice for Ontarians. And we achieve this by public service through dynamic, principles-based and outcomes-focused regulation. FSRA is committed to attracting and retaining exceptional people who bring energy, expertise, and experience. This includes providing a comprehensive total rewards package that looks beyond compensation and takes into consideration those things that are important to employees:
High employee engagement scores with opportunity for growth, learning and developmentFlexibility with a hybrid work model in an office designed for collaborationCompetitive benefits plan, including a Defined Benefit pension planPromoting wellness and fostering an inclusive environment where all employees feel valued and respectedCulture of giving back to our communities through charitable activities
Job Description:
PURPOSE OF POSITION
Accountable for the analysis, development, and automation of Ontario insurance related data reporting on rating and risk classification systems, predictive models, and other insurance products in support of the regulation and supervision of the Ontario Auto Insurance industry.
Key Responsibilities
Leads the development of a suite of automated reporting dashboards leveraging various internal and external data sources and works in consultation with key internal and external stakeholders to enable evidence-based, outcomes focused regulatory decision-making efforts.Conducts data analysis and assessment of Ontario Auto Insurance data, risk classification systems, and related data products from the auto insurance industry to support evidence-based decision making within FSRA’s governance framework.Conducts advanced statistical analysis, natural language processing, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data mining to identify trends and issues with respect to consumer sentiment in the Ontario Auto Insurance marketplace.Ensures compliance with FRSA’s regulatory mandate, assesses and interprets data, measures model performance and interpretability, and draws business inferences related to auto insurance rate filings, rate changes, model changes.Maintains data mining tools, platforms and reporting suite for the Risk Classification Systems and Analytics Team while making recommendations for enhancements based on observations of the tools utilized and current processes followed.Collaborates with various internal FSRA teams to seek advice regarding the auto insurance pricing framework and to seek input, understand and document requirements for the development of new and improved data reporting and visualization tools.Collaborates with Actuarial Services to discuss and resolve issues regarding the overall performance of models or segments of the models, including but not limited to biases, weaknesses in models, areas not meeting the expectation of FSRA’s model governance framework, changes in pricing and to provide recommendations for change and resubmission of insurer models for underwriting, pricing and rates or to validate model results.Provide recommendations to FSRA’s data collection strategy, review data collected, and identify market trends, emerging issues, and emerging technologies that can be leveraged as part of the overall FSRA data and analytics strategy.
Qualifications
Education and Experience 
University or Post-Graduate degree in mathematics, actuarial sciences, statistics, or another relevant quantitative field.1-2 years’ experience in data analytics, data modeling, segmentation, data visualization and the analysis of large, complex datasets.Experience within the auto insurance industry is considered an asset.
Knowledge And Skills
Knowledge of, and skills in analytical and advanced statistical analyses, actuarial methods, predictive analytics, machine learning techniques.Advanced dashboard development and analytical reporting skills.Skilled in statistical and data models and methodologies.Oral and written communication skills to work collaboratively with internal stakeholders and to provide issues identification and resolution in dashboard and reporting development.Proficiency in the use of data mining, reporting and data visualization technologies

FSRA is committed to ensuring equity in employment. Our goal is to create a diverse, inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to ensure our services and communications are accessible to all individuals. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code.
FSRA is committed to the health and safety of our employees. To demonstrate our commitment to this critical priority and further protect against the spread and risks of COVID-19, and its variants, full vaccination against COVID-19 is required as a condition of employment for individuals hired by FSRA, subject to any duty to accommodate in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code. Fully vaccinated is defined as having received all of the required doses of a Health Canada approved vaccine and having received the final dose at least 14 days before commencing employment with FSRA.
